author: Staff Reporter
text:
The III Additional District Judge here on Monday sentenced a 32-year-old man to undergo life imprisonment for murder over business rivalry in 2013.

Assistant Public Prosecutor of the court P.E. Augustus said that the victim C. Aathi alias Senthil Prabhu (29), of Mudhalipalayam in Arasur, was a car broker and money lender.

The accused S. Muthu alias Muthuramalaingam of Neelambur Bypass was also a car broker.

Muthu asked Aathi to lend him money to buy a car, which the latter refused.

Around 11.45 p.m. on February 14, 2013, Muthu saw Aathi alone at Mudhalipalayam Pirivu, and picked a quarrel for not lending him money and attacked him with a billhook.

Aathi died on the spot. Sulur Police booked Muthu under section 302 (murder) of the Indian Penal Code and arrested him.

On completion of the trial on Monday, the III – Additional District Judge Karthikeyan convicted the accused and also imposed a fine of Rs. 2,000 on him.
title: Man gets life term for murder
